item.title: Bagging and Random Forest
item.description: Ensemble Learning Ensemble methods aim at improving the predictive performance of a given statistical learning or model ﬁtting technique. The general principle of ensemble methods is to construct a linear combination of some model ﬁtting method, instead of using a single ﬁt of the method. An ensemble is itself a supervised learning algorithm, because it can be trained and then used to make predictions. Ensemble methods combine several decision trees classifiers to produce better predictive performance than a single decision tree classifier.
